required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of White Potatoes on Glycemic Response and Satiety in Older Adults
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of White Potatoes on Glycemic Response and Satiety in Older Adults

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the present study is to explore the influence of cooking methods of potatoes on post-prandial glycaemia and satiety in healthy older adults.

detailed_description.textblock: Each of the 5 study sessions will be at least 7 days apart. Either meal skipping, or one of three treatments of white potatoes (a) baked (with skin), (b) mashed, (c) fried French fries, or white bread, prepared on the day of testing, will be served to healthy older adults (65+ years). Participants will consume the equivalent to 1 medium sized potato (~280 kcal) or an equivalent amount of calories from white bread. Glycemic response, insulin, incretin hormones (glucagon-like peptide-1 (GLP-1), glucose-dependent insulinotropic peptide (GIP)), dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP4), and cholecystokinin (CCK) will be measured for 2 h (0, 15, 30, 45, 60, 90 and 120 min) following meal consumption, as well as mood and subjective appetite. An ad libitum test meal will be provided at 120 min to assess food intake suppression.

primary_outcome.measure: Ad libitum food intake (lunch, at 120 minutes)
primary_outcome.description: Food intake will be determined by weighing the meal before and after serving. The net weight of the test meal will be converted to calories

primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline and then 15, 30, 45, 60, 90 and 120 minutes after meal consumption
primary_outcome.description: Blood glucose (mmol/L). Blood glucose will be measured in whole blood using YSI 2300 STAT PLUS (YSI Incorporated, Yellow Springs, OH)

primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline and then 15, 30, 45, 60, 90 and 120 minutes after meal consumption
primary_outcome.description: Blood insulin (pmol/L). Insulin concentration in serum will be determined in duplicate via enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay kits (ELISA; Millipore, Billerica, Massachusetts).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline and then 15, 30, 45, 60, 90 and 120 minutes after meal consumption
secondary_outcome.description: Measured using visual analogue scale (mm). Each VAS is a 100 mm line where they will place a pencil mark to describe their feelings.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline and then 15, 30, 45, 60, 90 and 120 minutes after meal consumption
secondary_outcome.description: Measured using visual analogue scale (mm). Each VAS is a 100 mm line where they will place a pencil mark to describe their feelings.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline and then 15, 30, 45, 60, 90 and 120 minutes after meal consumption
secondary_outcome.description: Blood CCK (pmol/L). CCK concentration in serum will be determined in duplicate via enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay kits (ELISA; Millipore, Billerica, Massachusetts)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline and then 15, 30, 45, 60, 90 and 120 minutes after meal consumption
secondary_outcome.description: Blood DPP4 (ng/mL). DPP4 concentration in serum will be determined in duplicate via enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay kits (ELISA; Millipore, Billerica, Massachusetts)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline glucose-dependent insulinotropic peptide (GIP)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline and then 15, 30, 45, 60, 90 and 120 minutes after meal consumption
secondary_outcome.description: Blood GIP (pmol/L). GIP concentration in serum will be determined in duplicate via enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay kits (ELISA; Millipore, Billerica, Massachusetts)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline and then 15, 30, 45, 60, 90 and 120 minutes after meal consumption
secondary_outcome.description: Blood GLP-1 (pmol/L). GLP-1 concentration in serum will be determined in duplicate via enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay kits (ELISA; Millipore, Billerica, Massachusetts)

arm_group.description: Matched for energy content and available carbohydrate content of potato treatments
Mashed potatoes prepared from frozen, matched for available carbohydrate content of baked potato
Matched for available carbohydrate content of baked potato

intervention.description: Toasted, with canola oil added to match for fat content of French fries (13.9 grams), as well as being matched for energy (280 kilocalories) and available carbohydrate content (33 grams) of potato treatments.
Baked russet potato with canola oil added once baked to match for fat content of French fries, and also matched for the salt content of white bread (280 milligrams).
Mashed potatoes prepared from frozen, with canola oil added to match for fat content of French fries, as well as being matched for energy and available carbohydrate content of the baked potato.
Prepared from frozen, matched for energy and available carbohydrate content of baked potato and salt content of white bread.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- be 65 years or older
- be healthy
- not be taking medications that affect food intake regulation or blood glucose
Exclusion Criteria:
- anyone with food sensitivities or allergies to potatoes or potato-products,
- smokers
- diabetic or overweight/obese individuals.
